title: Payment Posting Specialist
job_overview:
(Work from Home – Pacific Time Hours | Full-Time | 2 Openings)
Overview
We are hiring two experienced Payment Posters to join our remote team supporting a healthcare organization based in California. This full-time position is ideal for professionals with a strong background in U.S. medical billing and payment posting, particularly within platforms like CollaborateMD.
The role requires working graveyard hours (Pacific Time zone) and offers a stable, long-term opportunity for reliable and detail-oriented individuals.
Key Responsibilities
Post payments accurately in CollaborateMD (CMD) for all assigned facilities.
Review EOBs and insurance reason codes to determine correct application of payments.
Apply patient responsibilities appropriately and set correct claim statuses for routing back to the A/R team as needed.
Assign statuses such as:
Policy Terminated at Insurance – reason code 200
Denied at Insurance – unclear denial or general denial codes (e.g., 197, 204)
Recoupment Requested at Insurance – payment reversal or overpayment letters
Add detailed and accurate notes in CMD and Salesforce, including patient details and denial explanations.
Manually apply payments received via email (checks or credit cards).
Check shared folders and payer portals (e.g., Zelis, ECHO) for additional payments not received via ERA.
Respond to payment-related inquiries from facilities in a timely and professional manner.
Run routine reports:
Pending Payments – locate and manually apply missing payments
Spot Check Reports – verify applied payments and review for unusual patient responsibilities or overpayments
Support team communication by flagging recoupment or denial trends and unusual payer behavior.

Qualifications
Minimum 2–3 years of hands-on experience with U.S. medical payment posting.
Proficiency with CollaborateMD or a similar billing system.
Ability to interpret EOBs, payer correspondence, and denial codes accurately.
Excellent attention to detail, with consistent documentation and note-taking.
Confident working independently, while being communicative and reliable within a remote team
Strong English reading comprehension and written communication skills.

Technical Requirements
Must have a reliable internet connection with minimum speeds of 50 Mbps download / 50 Mbps upload.
Must have backup internet and power options in place to ensure consistent attendance and performance.
Ability to join scheduled ZooUpgrade to see actual infoetings, communicate via Slack, and follow email-based workflows.

Work Schedule & Setup
Full-Time: 40 hours per week
Schedule: Must be available during Pacific Time (U.S. graveyard hours)
Location: Remote – Philippines (work from home)
Must have a quiet, secure workspace with reliable hardware for handling confidential healthcare data.
Bonus Skills (Nice to Have)
Experience using Salesforce to manage VOB or payment notes.
Familiarity with ERA setup, payer portal troubleshooting, and U.S. insurance workflows.
